intro: Tetrameris brachyandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetrameris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in shrubland habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. It produces yellowish-green flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
